page.title: 14LEISURE & ENTERTAINMENT.
page.content: There are few pubs, one hotel with a restaurant, one W/Mans Club in the block. Thus an evening out often means going to B/Auckland or Spennymoor. The Binchester Community Centre provides various activities; dancing, discos, keep fit, snooker/table tennis, youth club, etc. Similarly the Chapel Hall, Newfield is used for social functions. Here also the Club provides bingo and live entertainment. Outdoors there are country walks; old railways are nature trecks, attractive river-banks used for picnics. Camping is enjoyed by some.Allotments &pigeons are popular with the men; motor-bikes with the boys. Larger communities have football pitches &play-parks. Jazz-bands, with gay uniforms,music & marching under majorettes, are popular with girls&mothers alike; making for fierce competition at local carnivals.
